task.title: Set Line Spacing
task.shortdesc: Manual typewriters allow you to easily adjust the line spacing of your text.

step.note: The line spacer is a small lever located on the left-hand side of the typewriter, usually right above the carriage return lever.

Next to the lever, you will notice some numbering. This numbering corresponds to the pre-set spacing options your machine will have. Typically, a number "1" will correspond to single spacing, "2" will correspond to double spacing, and "3" will correspond to triple spacing.
step.cmd: Shift the lever to the spacing you prefer

substep.cmd: To ensure you have properly set your desired spacing, type a word or two and hit the carriage return lever to see if your line spacing is set correctly.
